alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 01 at 12:16PM MST until February 03 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW, SLICK AND HAZARDOUS TRAVEL, AND MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .An extended period of snow, colder temperatures, and slick and hazardous travel conditions can be expected through Wednesday. A slow moving storm system will move into the area this afternoon, and remain across Colorado through Wednesday. Snow will continue to develop and spread across the Front Range, I-25 Corridor, and adjacent plains through the late afternoon and evening hours. Snow intensity will be heaviest this evening, but light snow will continue overnight and through Wednesday. The snow will come to an end Wednesday evening, but temperatures will be very cold. For the latest road conditions, go to cotrip.org or dial 511. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 7 to 14 inches. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, and The Southern Front Range Foothills. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Travel may become very difficult due to heavy snowfall on roadways.
info.instruction: Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination. Consider altering your travel plans. Heavy snowfall is expected to make travel very difficult to impossible.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
